page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: This area has been grazed since the Iron Age out of neighbouring Hill Forts which are still very much in evidence archaeologically. Existing farms have their roots in the Feudal System.The Welsh word "Plas" means "Manor",and farms bearing this name, e.g. "Plas y Ward" &"Plas yr Esgob"(Esgob=Bishop) exist today,denoting Church as well as gentry ownership. Farms today range from approx.150-250 acres with Dairy Farming predominant on the best land and sheep grazing on the more difficult terrain.Most feed crops are grown.Silage has taken over from hay as part of the general mechanisation of farming in the region.Some farms are owned but most are tenanted.
